item.title: Books
item.description: A place for me to talk about books. Favorite books § The Locked Tomb series I actually have a (neglected) web shrine ninthtomb.rip but unfortunately I haven’t done much with it yet.

item.title: Goals
item.description: A place for me to just talk off the cuff about my personal goals and plans. At the moment it’s a little empty, but this is helpful as I begin to really dig into what I’m interested in.

item.title: Japanese
item.description: This is my main page for collecting resources and planning my Japanese journey Resources § Transclude of block japanese.

item.title: Linguistics
item.description: I am fascinated by language and the ways they evolve and the forms they take. While I mainly want to study linguistics in order to better help me learn Japanese, I would love to develop a conlang or two with it.

item.title: Absolute Values in Algebra
item.description: Absolute values in algebra is a bit weird but aside from some specific rules they’re pretty fun to solve. First off, you cannot change the inside signs of an absolute value.

item.title: Big Unorganized Math Notes
item.description: Turns out making specific pages for each note has been bad for me actually making notes, so here I’m just gonna spam all the notes without much explaining.

item.title: Completing The Square
item.description: Sometimes it’s easier to modify an equation so it becomes a full quadradic equation. Take the following: As it is this is not factorable, and while you can use quadratic method instead, you can force it to be factorable! You can do this whenever the b term is even, this will not work if b term is odd.

item.title: Exponents
item.description: Exponents are pretty easy to understand if you understand what squaring and cubing are, but exponential functions are a little wacky. Exponential Functions §.

item.title: Important Formulas
item.description: mjx-container[jax="SVG"] { direction: ltr; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"] > svg { overflow: visible; min-height: 1px; min-width: 1px; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"] > svg a { fill: blue; stroke: blue; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"][display="true"] { display: block; text-align: center; margin: 1em 0; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"][display="true"][width="full"] { display: flex; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"][justify="left"] { text-align: left; } mjx-container[jax="SVG"][justify="right"] { text-align: right; } g[data-mml-node="merror"] > g { fill: red; stroke: red; } g[data-mml-node="merror"] > rect[data-background] { fill: yellow; stroke: none; } g[data-mml-node="mtable"] > line[data-line], svg[data-table] > g > line[data-line] { stroke-width: 70px; fill: none; } g[data-mml-node="mtable"] > rect[data-frame], svg[data-table] > g > rect[data-frame] { stroke-width: 70px; fill: none; } g[data-mml-node="mtable"] > .

item.title: Logarithms
item.description: Logarithms are weird. Logarithms are really, really weird. They have lots of properties that are similar to both functions and variables, but they aren’t either.
